text.p: Suppose that [mathjaxinline]T: \mathbb R^9 \rightarrow \mathbb R^4[/mathjaxinline] is a linear transformation which is not onto.
What is the strongest conclusion we can make about the kernel of [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline]?

p.p: The dimension of [mathjaxinline]\mathrm{Ker}(T)[/mathjaxinline] is at least

font.p: Since [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] is not onto, the rank of [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] cannot be 4. Thus the rank is at most 3. Since the rank plus the nullity must equal 9, this means the nullity is at least 6. The kernel is a subspace of [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^9[/mathjaxinline], so its dimension is at most 9.
